p: During apoptosis, there are alterations such as cytoplasmic blebbing, cell volume reduction, loss of mitochondrial membrane potential, condensation of nuclear chromatin, and DNA fragmentation [ 71]. Such characteristics were observed from the essential oils of Cinnamodendron dinisii [ 14], Siparuna guianensis [ 14], Cinnamomum verum [ 19], Lippia dulcis [ 30], Achyrocline satureioides [ 61, 62], Lippia sidoides [ 13], Lippia origanoides [ 13, 30, 65], Chenopodium ambrosioides [ 13], Justicia pectorales [ 13], Lippia citriodora [ 30], Lippia pedunculosa [ 31] and Lippia alba [ 30]. However, due to the large number of components and potential synergistic and/or antagonistic interactions between them, it is likely that in addition to membranes, essential oils can also act against other cellular targets ( Figure 2).
